      • train

        public org.deeplearning4j.nn.api.Model train​(MLConf global_conf)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Example: Given a movie review (raw text), classify that movie review as either positive or negative based on the words it contains. This is done by combining Word2Vec vectors and a recurrent neural network model. Each word in a review is vectorized (using the Word2Vec model) and fed into a recurrent neural network. Training data is the "Large Movie Review Dataset" from http://ai.stanford.edu/~amaas/data/sentiment/ This data set contains 25,000 training reviews + 25,000 testing reviews Process: 1. Automatic on first run of example: Download data (movie reviews) + extract 2. Load existing Word2Vec model (for example: Google News word vectors. You will have to download this MANUALLY) 3. Load each each review. Convert words to vectors + reviews to sequences of vectors 4. Train network With the current configuration, gives approx. 83% accuracy after 1 epoch. Better performance may be possible with additional tuning. NOTE / INSTRUCTIONS: You will have to download the Google News word vector model manually. ~1.5GB The Google News vector model available here: https://code.google.com/p/word2vec/ Download the GoogleNews-vectors-negative300.bin.gz file Then: set the WORD_VECTORS_PATH field to point to this location.
        Specified by:
        train in class MLConf
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
